mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Robert Dinwiddie, 1757 March 10
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In this letter, Washington writes from Philadelphia and petitions colonial governor Robert Dinwiddie on behalf of the officers of the Virginia Regiment for official commissions in the British Army. Washington writes that, “We cant conceive, that being Americans shoud deprive us of the benefits of British Subjects; nor lessen our claim to preferment: and we are very certain, that no Body of regular Troops ever before Servd 3 Bloody Campaigns without attracting Royal Notice.” Although Washington went on to serve two more years, he never received a British officer’s commission. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages.
